title.narrative: 2.3 DISTRICT WATER & SANITATION SYSTEM

description.narrative: By 2017, people living in selected districts, VDCs and municipalities (including schools and vulnerable communities) increasingly stop open defecation and utilize and participate in managing safe and sustainable, gender- and disability-friendly sanitation facilities and functional water supply facilities, which contributes to Hygiene, Sanitation, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, in selected areas (the most disadvantaged districts and municipalities), social sector systems are providing integrated, quality services to fulfil the survival, development, protection and participation rights of children, adolescents and women with equity in all contexts, including humanitarian situations

participating-org.narrative: EKDARA GA PA GA KA PA OFFICE

sector.narrative: Hygiene - handwashing with soap in communities
Sanitation - eliminating open defecation in peri-urban and urban communities
Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - eliminating open defecation in rural communities
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
Water - climate resilience and environmental sustainability
Water supply - peri-urban and urban communities service delivery
Water supply - rural communities service delivery
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration
Water supply and Sanitation rural sanitation

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2017, people living in selected districts, VDCs and municipalities (including schools and vulnerable communities) increasinglystop open defecation and utilize and participate in managing safe and sustainable, gender- and disability-friendly sanitationfacilities and functional water supply facilities

description.narrative: National sanitation coverage has increased from 88 to 94 per cent while in 34 UNICEF supported districts it rose from 87 to 94 per cent. Additionally, nationally 210 VDCs and 9 municipalities have declared open defaecation free (ODF), UNICEF directly supported 77 VDCs and seven municipalities. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: Number of community-based water supply schemes where the User Committee has prepared and implemented a Water Safety Plan

actual.value: 2017:180 water safety plan projects completed benefiting 241,988 people.

title.narrative: % of community based water supply schemes in priority districts with improved functionality from need minor repairs to functioning well

baseline.value: 38.9 per cent average ( per cent varies by districts) (source NMIP)

target.value: 2017:50 per cent improvement from baseline in each priority district

actual.value: 2017:199 water supply schemes are fully functional as a result of water safety plan and construction and or repair of water supply projects benefitting 431,188 people. (Denominator is unavailable)

title.narrative: Number of low sanitation coverage VDCs and municipalities declared and certified Open Defecation Free (ODF) in UNICEF supported districts

actual.value: 2017:77 VDCs and 7 municipalities have certified and declared ODF in UNICEF supported districts
